title: New York Times Alum Feels Like an Oregonian
sub_head: Now he just needs a change in Beaver State law to be eligible for a gubernatorial run.
body:
if you think New York Times columnists are going overboard in their opposition to state laws requiring voter identification, you should see what happens after they leave the newspaper. One former Timesman is now arguing that an ineligible candidate should be Oregon’s next governor.
Brent Walth reports for Politico on the troubled effort by former Times columnist Nicholas Kristof to become the state’s senior official:
